# Discord Channel Analysis: ðŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary:
The discussion in the developers channel primarily focused on AR/VR applications and development progress. MetaMike inquired about AR use cases, which prompted suggestions including card games with AI-generated models and interactions, as well as AR versions of physical games like mini golf and shuffleboard. There was a technical update about Hyperfy working on Quest 3, with controllers functioning but requiring button remaps and lacking menu functionality. A developer mentioned accessing their "local world natively" and planning to work on mobile controls. Teknopath shared progress on new debugging tooling that's approximately 90% complete, with positive initial results from remote tooling implementation. MetaMike later shared a specific AR use case involving gun assembly/disassembly visualization for training purposes.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Does anyone have an AR use case? (asked by MetaMike) A: Several users provided examples including card games with AI interactions and traditional games in AR (answered by maximus)
Q: What's the status of Hyperfy on Quest 3? (implied from teknopath's update) A: It works with controllers showing up, though some button remaps are needed and menus aren't functioning (answered by teknopath)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: teknopath | Helpee: Community | Context: Sharing progress on Hyperfy Quest 3 compatibility | Resolution: Confirmed it works with controllers but needs button remaps and lacks menus
Helper: teknopath | Helpee: Community | Context: Development of debugging tools | Resolution: Reported 90% completion with positive initial results from remote tooling

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Complete state consolidation for debugging PR | Description: Finalize the remaining 10% of tooling development | Mentioned By: teknopath
Feature: Implement AR card game with AI-generated models and interactions | Description: Create system where playing cards generates 3D models with interactive behaviors | Mentioned By: maximus
Feature: Develop AR traditional games (mini golf, shuffleboard, bocce) | Description: Create AR versions of physical games that can be set up anywhere | Mentioned By: maximus
Feature: Create AR gun assembly/disassembly training application | Description: Interactive AR tool for practicing gun part assembly on a table surface | Mentioned By: MetaMikeC
Technical: Improve mobile controls for local world access | Description: Further development of mobile controls after achieving native local world access | Mentioned By: .hyp shaman

# Analysis of Discord Chat in "âš¡â”‚general" Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily contains a discussion about Hyperfy's business model and token economics rather than technical content. There's a debate between users about whether Hyperfy needs investors and token transparency, with some users expressing concern about token allocation and unlock schedules while others argue that the project can succeed based on its technology without traditional investment. The only technical discussion involves a brief exchange about toggling the free roam camera in Hyperfy v2, where a user asks how to access this feature that was available via the "P" key in v1. Another user provides a solution by sharing a link to an app that needs to be added first, mentioning it has a UI for settings and toggles.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How do I toggle the free roam camera in v2? This was "P" in v1 (asked by untitled, xyz) A: For now it's an app you need to add first. It has a UI for settings and toggles. (answered by vox)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: vox | Helpee: untitled, xyz | Context: User needed to know how to toggle free roam camera in Hyperfy v2 that was previously accessed with "P" key in v1 | Resolution: vox shared a link to an app that needs to be added first, which has a UI for settings and toggles

## 4. Action Items
Documentation: Update documentation to explain how to access free roam camera in v2 | Mentioned By: untitled, xyz

The chat segment is extremely brief, containing only two messages. Users "vox" and "Dhin" mentioned they are using prompting techniques, with vox creating a "Prop Library" and Dhin working on a "franchise." No technical discussions, problem-solving, or concrete implementations were shared in this limited exchange.
